newsitem.title: USA: Wall Street stocks seen opening higher.
newsitem.headline: Wall Street stocks seen opening higher.

text.p: Wall Street stocks are expected to open higher on Thursday, relentlessly pushing into new records for the fifth straight day.

But analysts said investors would be watching for the expected U.S. May retail sales data due at 0830 EDT/1230 GMT, as well as the Producer Price Index (PPI) figures due Friday, for any sign of inflation, which could in turn lead to a retreat in the stock market. Retail sales should show a rise of 0.4 percent in May after an April 0.3 percent decline, according to analysts polled by Reuters.
